thread.section_title: Four Points by Sheraton Midtown - Times Square - UPDATED 2017 Hotel Reviews & Price Comparison (New York City) - TripAdvisor
thread.title: Work Trip
thread.title_full: Work Trip - Review of Four Points by Sheraton Midtown - Times Square, New York City, NY - TripAdvisor

author: Tash D
title: Work Trip
text:
Location: Perfect.
Time square: 5 min walk
Cafes, dining : 2 min walk- so much to choose from!
Drug store: 1 min walk, you can buy healthy food options in there too.
Clothes Shopping: around Maceys, 5-10 min walk
Subway: 1 min walk
Bus terminal: across the road
Newark airport: aprox 40 min tax ride, USD $110 (non peak hour time)
Javits center :11 min walk.
Rooms:
I choose to pay for a city view- it was spectacular and Im very grateful I did. We had the 28 floor and it was so lovely to see the city light up at night.
No problem with noise.
The rooms are adequate size, by the end of the trip they felt small- but I was not in the room much.
They were clean.
I brought some basic utensils from home to eat / cook with when I did not feel like eating out. The coffee machine boils water.
I brought ice up from the basement to keep things cold- and kept it by the window (it was snowing)
The bathroom was small but sufficient, great showers!!.
Lifts:
Good 3 lifts- I think once at 8.40am I had to wait up to 5 minutes for the lift, other than that they were great.
Service:
The staff were so friendly and really made an effort. I wish i wrote down their names to give them the credit they deserve. It made such a difference, travelling to such a huge city can be stressfull and they put my mind at ease.
Food:
I only had breakfast here- which was good enough.
I 100% would be back again.
Room Tip: level 28 had good city view rooms. See more room tips
